title: Prince Harry steps up press battle with phone hacking claim against Sun and Mirror newspapers
text:
The Duke of Sussex is to sue the owners of The Mirror and The Sun over phone hacking, it has been confirmed, as he escalates his battle against Britain’s tabloid newspapers.

The Duke has filed papers at the High Court over the illegal interception of voicemail messages dating back to the early 2000s.

It comes just days after his wife, the Duchess of Sussex, announced she was suing the Mail on Sunday over the publication of extracts of a letter written by her to her father.

Both Prince William and Prince Harry have been mentioned in previous phone hacking court cases, along with the Duchess of Cambridge and members of palace staff. It is believed the current legal claim relates only to the Duke of Sussex.

Previous allegations involving the Princes cited in phone hacking court cases brought by other complainants related to when they were in their teens and 20s.
